protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
description: This protocol provides the detailed methods of assembly and annotation of the R. crenulata genome.
before_start: Get raw sequencing data in Fastq format.
protocol_affiliation: Institute of Chinese Medical Sciences, University of Macau, China
manuscript_citation: Fu Y, Li L, Hao S, Guan R, Fan G, Shi C, Wan H, Chen W, Zhang H, Liu G, Wang J, Ma L, You J, Ni X, Yue Z, Xu X, Sun X, Liu X, Lee SM, Draft genome sequence of the Tibetan medicinal herb . GigaScience 6(6). doi: 10.1093/gigascience/gix033

collections.protocol_name: Protocols for "Draft genome of the Tibetan medicinal herb, Rhodiola crenulata"

components.data: Filter the input raw sequences by using SOAPfilter (version 2.2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the input raw sequences by using SOAPfilter (version 2.2).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

components.data: Estimate the genome size (420 Mb) with k-mer analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Estimate the genome size (420 Mb) with k-mer analysis.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: k=17; reads from 250 bp-insert library as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.
source_data.thread_text: k=17; reads from 250 bp-insert library as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.
source_data.body: k=17; reads from 250 bp-insert library as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.

source_data.name: Platanus Assembler (PLATform for Assembling NUcleotide Sequences

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

source_data.name:
assemble (-k 35 -m 130 -u 0.2 -c 10 -s 10 -t 32)

scaffold (-l 3 -u 0.2 -v 32 -s 32)

gap_close (-t 32 -s 32 -ed 0.1)
source_data.description: (Perform assemble -> scaffold -> gap_close  modes in turn)

components.data: Perform Gapcloser (version 1.10) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform Gapcloser (version 1.10) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

components.data: Run RepeatModeler, RepeatScout and LTR_FINDER, respectively, to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run RepeatModeler, RepeatScout and LTR_FINDER, respectively, to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

components.data: Based on the library constructed above as database, run RepeatMasker (version 3.3.0) to find and then classify the repetitive sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Based on the library constructed above as database, run RepeatMasker (version 3.3.0) to find and then classify the repetitive sequences.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

components.data: Run RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (version 3.3.0) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against existing databases, Repbase TE library (Version 17.01) and TE protein database.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (version 3.3.0) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against existing databases, Repbase TE library (Version 17.01) and TE protein database.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation

components.data: Mask these repetitive regions obtained above (step 5-7) with 'N's.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mask these repetitive regions obtained above (step 5-7) with 'N's.

components.data: Run Augustus (version 2.5.5) and GlimmerHMM (version 3.0.1) to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run Augustus (version 2.5.5) and GlimmerHMM (version 3.0.1) to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: using parameters "--species=arabidopsis --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using parameters "-f -g" and trained by arabidopsis when running GlimmerHMM
source_data.thread_text: using parameters "--species=arabidopsis --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using parameters "-f -g" and trained by arabidopsis when running GlimmerHMM
source_data.body: using parameters "--species=arabidopsis --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using parameters "-f -g" and trained by arabidopsis when running GlimmerHMM

components.data: Download protein sequences of homlog species (arabidopsis, wild strawberry, peach and Chinese plum), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAT, and then based on the BLAT mapping results, run GeneWise (version 2.2.0 ) to predict genes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download protein sequences of homlog species (arabidopsis, wild strawberry, peach and Chinese plum), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAT, and then based on the BLAT mapping results, run GeneWise (version 2.2.0 ) to predict genes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"
source_data.thread_text: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"
source_data.body: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"

components.data: Integrate genes predicted in step 9-10 to obtain the consensus gene set by using GLEAN.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Integrate genes predicted in step 9-10 to obtain the consensus gene set by using GLEAN.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"
source_data.thread_text: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"
source_data.body: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"

components.data: Perform TopHat (version 2.1.0) with default parameters to align clean RNA-seq reads against gene set mentioned in Step11, and then use Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) to assemble these transcripts, then use training parameters to predict ORFs, and finally obtain the more intergrity and trusty gene set.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform TopHat (version 2.1.0) with default parameters to align clean RNA-seq reads against gene set mentioned in Step11, and then use Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) to assemble these transcripts, then use training parameters to predict ORFs, and finally obtain the more intergrity and trusty gene set.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 12 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: filtering RNA sequencing data firstly by performing SOAPnuke with parameters “-l 10 -q 0.5 -n 0.01 -f AGTCGGAGGCCAAGCGGTCTTAGGAAGACAA -Q 2”
source_data.thread_text: filtering RNA sequencing data firstly by performing SOAPnuke with parameters “-l 10 -q 0.5 -n 0.01 -f AGTCGGAGGCCAAGCGGTCTTAGGAAGACAA -Q 2”
source_data.body: filtering RNA sequencing data firstly by performing SOAPnuke with parameters “-l 10 -q 0.5 -n 0.01 -f AGTCGGAGGCCAAGCGGTCTTAGGAAGACAA -Q 2”

components.data: Run BUSCO and map transcriptome data to our final gene set to assess the completeness.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run BUSCO and map transcriptome data to our final gene set to assess the completeness.

components.data: Map protein sequences of the final gene set to existing databases to identify their functions or motifs, such as SwissProt, TrEMBL, KEGG, InterPro.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Map protein sequences of the final gene set to existing databases to identify their functions or motifs, such as SwissProt, TrEMBL, KEGG, InterPro.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 14 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name_html: The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.annotation: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
source_data.thread_text: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
source_data.body: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
